title: This Dhanteras, pick iron over gold
text:
Dhanteras, a day on which devotees perfrom ‘dhan pooja’, is considered an extremely auspicious day to worship your wealth and purchase something precious and new, which signifies keeping your coffers full.





This year, a campaign is urging women to invest in another element—iron. Project Streedhan asks women to give iron levels in their bodies an equal importance as the precious metal. The data presented by the campaign (from the government’s National Family Health Survey, 2016) shows that one out of every two women in the country is anaemic, its main cause being deficiency of iron. The condition leads to weakness and exhaustion. It also states that India ranks the highest in world for prevalence of anaemia among its women, and over 50 per cent of those in urban India are also anaemic.





The campaign uses the hashtag #InvestInIron to urge women to eat foods rich in iron. The tagline of the video reads ‘My iron is my real wealth’. Project Streedhan shared a video on social media, and it has garnered a lot of positive response, apart from vocal support by celebrities including actor Vidya Balan. She took to Instagram to share a picture with her favourite iron-rich food—dates.
